I thought maybe they do not know and my suggestion would be helpful. First they said she is busy. Then after 10 minutes someone who introduced herself as floor manager came and asked what is the problem. I explained that the salad is nothing close to being Persian and compared to the price they charge this is not acceptable. Then similar to the way she responded to the other desk, she started to lecture me why everyone likes their salad and they way they do it is the right way. She said foreigners come here as well and they like it this way. I said but you are a Persian restaurant and this is not authentic. And this is not a good excuse to be sloppy and just mix some salad and add some vinaigrette because you do not care. I asked that she should at least tell the customer that this is not authentic persian salad when taking orders, and she unapologetically said that would take a long time for the waiter to write down!!! Very mean and adamant. The least you can do is to thank the customer for their suggestion and do not implement it if you think he is wrong, not to argue and lecture him in front of his guests. I had to end it with a fake smile so that my friends do not think we had an argument.Very bad experience, will not come back.
author: Amir G.

description: Good food. Traditional Persian taste and Iranian hospitality. I felt like I was eating real homemade food.  Perfect service and friendly employees. We tried their fried fish and ghorme sabzi with tahdig. So delicious. Just wish it was in a Better location closer to all the hotels.
author: Jaz S.

description:
We've never really had Persian food before, so we didn't know what to expect here.

The girls that work here are extremely nice (and beautiful) and they helped us pick items off the menu.  

We had the lamb kebab and chicken kebab combined with rice, salmon with zucchini stew, yogurt with cucumber, forgot the name but some kind of yogurt drink, rice pudding, and tea.

We had a lot of rice so couldnt finish the dessert unfortunately, but everything was delish. 

Only unfortunate part is that they don't have the alcohol license yet.  But I'm sure it's coming soon.
author: EriCardo F.

description: My first time at an Iranian place as far as I can recall. I liked it but was not feeling like I needed to rush back. Some of the food was great, other food was just fine. The drink selection would have been good in the 90s, but it was unimpressive today. Decor is simple. The service was good and the family was friendly.
author: Andrew O.

description: My first time at a Persian restaurant. Some of the dishes were familiar so I asked about others on the menu. The recommendation was a rice dish with berries and chicken baked in spices. I'll never know how to pronounce the name. And I will NEVER forget it either. It was amazing. The saffron rice, melded in the shape of a paisley with rice and these little red berries that made the rice pink was outstanding. Couldn't stop eating! Next time in San Francisco, I'm definitely coming back.
author: Swinda P.

description: It is a nice little place with decent food. Not the best but great to grab a bite if you're in the area. We ordered a variety of different things including pita, hummus, kebabs etc -  all of them were good. I particularly liked their vegetable kebabs.
author: Maddy K.

description: wow . cute restaurant  I was really excited about a persion restaurant and  their food is very good quality .great  service and delicious food claen place.
author: Roza F.

description: Love this place.  Love Persian food.  Happy this little gem is in my neighborhood and within walking distance.  SoMA needs more family owned ethnic joints!  Aside from the food being great, the service was terrific.  I've been four times now and will definitely come back!
author: Alex T.

description:
I am Persian and I can write this is one of the BEST Persian restaurants I've ever been to...and I live near Los Angeles, where the best Persian food resides. I'm in town on business and was looking for a good Persian restaurant and read the positive reviews on this place and decided to give it a try...so happy I did, worth every penny!

The food is fabulous. I ordered the must-o-khiar (yogurt with cucumbers and mint), the tadiq (the crispy rice from the bottom of the pot) and the kabob barg (sirloin beef with rice)...the rice was cooked perfectly and the meat was tender and flavorful (there are plenty of options if you don't eat meat). The staff is warm and friendly in this family owned and operated business. The decor and ambience is great. 

You don't want to miss Anar, I will be back again the next time I'm in San Francicso, for sure!
author: Moni L.

description: The food is soso. I'm Persian so the quest for kabob is never ending. Had the Soltani with maast mooseer. The yogurt didn't have enough flavor. Tasted like plain bland yogurt with some bits of elephant garlic (mooseer). The koobideh kabob had a gamey lamb smell but the filet was decent. I think they need to put a little bit more work into the recipes before more people start to go there. My favorite still is Alborz.
author: Hooman M.

description: I gotta say the food here is ALRIGHT I wasn't a big fan of the koobideh it had a weird taste to it but wasn't horrible the chicken breast was pretty good the place it's self is very nice and organized but the dishes in my opinion I think they are a little over priced and if you order a soda they only have soda cans for $3 which I thought was a little high of price as well as the food.
author: Johnson Y.

description: This place is not good! I don't understand where all the good reviews are coming from. The service was not good. The food had zero flavor. Only reason it got two stars is because I like the inside of the restaurant. The hummus was the worst I have ever had with absolutely no taste at all. I had to add my own lime juice and salt to it to give it a little flavor.... Won't be coming back.
author: Mallory R.

description: Awesome food and great service. Walking distance to the convention center. I Was in SF for a week and visited the place in 3 different times. Took friends there and they loved it too. Look forward in dinning there on my next visit.
author: Farshid R.

description:
I am the kind of guy that if I eat out it is the food that is important.
I have been in many Persian restaurants, but Anar is my favorite.
Their menu is comprehensive.
They are friendly and they aim to please. 
Despite the neighborhood at night, It's worth the trip.
author: Amir M.

description: I really liked it:) We ordered Koobideh, joojeh and barg,  all were delicious:)) i will definitely go there again.
author: Fargol G.

description: Really tasty eggplant dishes - both of them. Get the side of yogurt with cucumber and spices. The flat bread is amazing as well.
author: Raj S.

description: I don't recall shouting at anyone and I also don't recall speaking to you. I do recall being treated extremely rudely by your host who did not even apologize once for closing early. You have done a great job of showing yelpers that you would rather close early than to serve new excited first time customers. I will be surprised if you are open in a year with that mindset. Good luck.
author: Vaghar H.

description: Excellent service food was delicious  classy environment friendly owners
author: Tony V.

description: Very good and reasonably priced Persian food. At this family owned restaurant you see menu items that not all Persian restaurants have, which reminds you of home cooked meals. Both sisters working there are very nice and friendly, it's definitely worth going.
author: Negin S.

description: My go-to place for koobideh. Service is great, I like the decor, parking is always easy and food has always been awesome. And the wait staff is always so pleasant and friendly.
author: Nick K.

description: food was good but the service was terrible. We were company of 10 people we ordered a lot of food at the end it was time for closing they didnt want to serve us Tea, which you cant end dinner of persian food without a tea. it was very disappointing. I will not go there any more
author: Alona R.

description: My favorite Persian Restaurant in the City!   Excellent food, friendly and knowledgeable staff and good wine list.  All menu items are fresh and delicious.  A must try!
author: jerry t.

description: JUST GO ANAR FOR PERSIAN FOODS.I just recommend this amazing restaurant to every one. I have had Koobideh, Mirza Ghaseni and Ghormeh sabzi and all were tasty. But I can simply die for Faloodeh :)
author: Shima S.

description:
I love this Persian Restaurant !  This is an elevated cuisine, hearty and delicious, yet refined and superb.  I have loved every dish that I have tasted.  But, my personal favorites are the 
Joojeh Kebab ( boneless chicken kebab)  This dish is magic; they serve with a perfectly roasted tomato which is the perfect contrasting flavor for the dish, and the rice itself is heaven. And, my other current favorite is a sort of Herb Quiche served with barberries.  AMBROSIA!  So tasty and deeply sensuous.  This place is a treasure.  And I should not forget to mention the kind warm hospitality.
author: Marc D.

description:
With a group of friends we decided to check out this spot today. We walked in at 3:30, got seated, with no menus or water. One of us asked for water and it took them 15 mins to bring it. By the time they brought us the menus and we could order we had already been sitting there for 40 mins. After another 20 minutes she tells us they don't have any shiahlik and tells us to change our order to barg, after initially she said At 5:30 we still didn't have our food, when we asked the waitress/owner told us with attitude that half of our food was ready and if we want to wag together we have to wait. After that she started bringing out our food one at a time and she literally threw my plate in front of me and rolled her eyes at me. HELLO! At that point I was going to walk out but everyone said let's just eat and we will never come back here. I wish I had walked out! I got their "Akbar joojeh" it was so dry and tasteless. We did not complain. Some people ordered some tea. We were talking about a date I went on at maykadeh, (Persian restaurant in sf), she said we don't have tea, you can have tea at maykadeh! And she started screaming at us and saying we are paid by maykadeh! LoL I still can not believe what happened today, she was so rude, so rude, and she said she doesn't owe us anything.  Your horrible customer service, and your eye rollings and bad attitude is the reason we started praising maykadeh, it's only natural to wonder why we ended up in a place with horrible food and the worst customer service EVER, when we could've gone to a place with good food and service. I think it's cute that they are getting all their relatives to write them
5 start reviews but I know for a fact 3 tables that were there today were traumatized. Do not go to this place! Or go try it for yourself if you wanna have a crazy story like mine to tell.
author: Sayeh I.

description:
THE SERVICE SUCKS!!!!!!!
This is The worse restaurant I have ever been In SF and worse behavior I have ever seen in my entire life.
The food came 1.30 hours Late Not to mention the rude waitress who was full of attitude.
It's a family owned business with no experience in food business and customer service.They basically changed our order without asking.
The food was nothing special.
They can't Give You Service if you are more than 5 Or in a Group.
author: Yass N.

description: We were a United States military family. My little sister was born in Tehran in 1976. Our transfer was accelerated just before the Revolution. I have the fondest memories of Persian people...warm, kind, and generous. Beautiful inside and out. So much so I married one. I have never known the Persian community to be so heartless to one another. Shame on you reviewers.
author: Jeff S.

description: Their service and food SUCKS!!! My experience from start to finish was horrible! Took them AN HOUR AND HALF no exaggeration to bring the food, the rice was very dry, and so was the Barg. The waitress was extremely rude and full of attitude. When we said something about the orders coming late instead of apologizing she said something about us being too many people and arguing with us. I don't recommend this place to anyone.
author: Shadi M.

description:
I am not sure if the staff is trying to improve or they think they know it best.... if its the latter then I am terribly sorry, as they probably wont last in this city with all the great restaurants around.

People running this establishment could definitely use some "Customer Service" training. In order for you to succeed, good food alone does not make it, you must go above and beyond to please your clients. It is very obvious that this is lacking in your environment. There are other choices in this town.

The food was very dry, and very mediocre at best, service is lacking or not even there. We drove over 45 minutes to try this restaurant and were completely disappointed.

We will probably give this place another try in due time, and hopefully they read the negative comments and learn from it just as they praise the 5 star comments.


Reply:


Dear Mr. Cyrus M, Thanks for taking the time and requesting details. For one thing, When I order Tah-Dig, I expect it to come with a stew, not plain... and when I asked,  I did not want to hear its a "Gift".... Gifts are exchanged between families and friends not at restaurant. It may be complimentary, but I am not there to receive complimentary items. I don't have a problem if you want to charge for it, but you cant tell me that's the only way it comes... Never been to a Persian restaurant where there was no Tah-Dig...

Your staff were very nice and pleasant in most part, but when we wanted to move the table to get some privacy, they almost panicked.. because if the table is moved it makes noises.. Really..!! Well fix the noise, and this is not what I want to hear..

Your Barg was so dry, that it was very chewey, after which another waiter said, oh maybe we should have asked how you would like it... 

We will return in due time, but I do hope you spend some time fixing the small stuff as it makes a huge different in how you are remembered. Best of luck to you.
author: Mike A.

description: Delicious food!!! Awesome customer service! Very friendly! All Appetizers are good! Very clean.
author: Fernando M.

description: This is the most disgusting attempt at Persian food I have ever tasted! I ordered this food for delivery and took one bite of the fish and one bite of their chicken and wanting to puke in my mouth doesn't even begin to explain the taste that was left. It it was possible to give this place no stars or negative stars; I would have given it a negative 1,000,000 stars. I would rather eat food out of the trash can than eat at this place! Save your wallet and walk away! DON'T EVEN THINK OF EATING HERE!!!!!!!!!!
author: Janda H.

description:
1.  Menu: On a Saturday nt, fesenjan was the only khoresh available (which I didn't want, the mahi (fish) dishes - "sorry we are out." .  The waitress said " We just changed the menu."  That sounded  not true.  I ended up with soltani, read meat which I also didn't really want.
 2.  The food: I rec'd no bread & butter while I waited for my khashe baramjan (sauted eggplant and whey) appetizer.  I liked the dish but it was served with cold but fresh, lavash.   The drizzle of sauted mint on top smelled great but the taste was overwhelmed with oil as was the khask but I love eggplant and I would get this again.       My entree, soltani was a disappointment:  the rice was cooked with too much water but had a generous topping of saffron.  The barg koobideh (spiced ground beef kabob) was delicious, hot, the way I like it.  The barg was tender, but warmer and not hot,  & not juicy like it should had it just came off of the grill.  I was very disappointed about this as it is filet mignon.  I had to ask for onions.  The grilled tomato was also a disappointment:  overcooked on the outside and undercooked on the inside as though it was rushed.  
3. Service:  The wait staff was interesting:  Two young women who seemed to think that I should just accept that the sparce menu just happened.  Definitely not 5 star. 
4.  Decor:  although the table clothes were a nice touch, the center peice was  a cheap Michale's vase with a small votive candle.  I think they were going for classy but fell short.   The wall hangers, however, were my favorite: 4 caligraphies of the word ANAR in Farsi.  The dot over the "n" was an abstract of a pomegrante (anar), in red, with the word anar written over and over again.  I would have bought one if they were on sale. 

Would I go again? No because I travel to get to SF and there are lots of other restaurants to try here.  Lots.
author: Mary A.

description: Amazing service, they make you feel at home! Take care of everything you ask for and more. The food is fresh and tasty for SF Persian food.
author: shoddy l.

description:
A lovely dining experience. Wonderful customer service from a family run restaurant. They were very warm and friendly, offering personalized suggestions for meal choices. 
The food was delicious- subtle spices and seasonings and gave me an impression of what traditional Persian food would taste like. 
I will definitely be back, my only suggestion for the restaurant being to serve a higher meat/vegetable to rice ratio. There was much too much rice served for us.
author: Susie O.

description: Anar is a new hidden gem for Persian cuisine in San Francisco! From the beautiful and unique art to the awesome selection on the menu - they're off to a great start! My friend who was with me said the zereshk polo was almost as delicious as his grandmother's - a huge compliment to any Persian chef!
author: Roya S.

description: Came here for lunch with my team at work.  We were able to book a large table via Yelp and I thought Awesome!  When we walked in it was deserted.  Well, the Yelp reviews were good so I thought "Weird, why doesn't anyone come?"  Well I soon found out. It took 45 min for the food to come out.  Nobody wanted to eat lunch here.  Not if you have a 1pm meeting.  If you have 3h to burn and is not hungry when you show up, then go ahead and try this place. The food was so-so, edible.  I've had better, and definitely faster.
author: Connie K.

description: Is the one of the best Persian Resturant in bay aria.
author: Seyed L.

description: I went to a lot of Persian restaurants in the world, clearly Anar stands out as the best Persian cuisine I've had - its homemade style with great ambiance. The quality is impressive. Its a must go to restaurant in San Francisco.
author: Bahman S.

description:
Anar has quickly become my go-to Persian restaurant in the Bay Area. I've been 5 times and all the food has been great, but their flavorful stews (Gormeh Sabzhi and Fesenjoon) are particularly awesome. Fight-over-leftovers-with-your-boyfriend awesome ;)

I've never had to wait for a table, which is a rare treat in San Francisco! To top it off, Anar is family-owned and operated, and they really show that they appreciate your business and care that you have a great experience.
author: Hannah L.

description:
nice environment, great customer service, delicious Koobideh.
food options are limited (at least on menu): just two Khoresh(stews) and no mixed rice (like loobia polo, adas polo,...)
Doogh was too salty.
Pomegranate juice was not juice at all, but pomegranate paste added to water and ice!
salad portion was very small compared to other Persian restaurants.
Tahdig was rice, not bread. too thick. it was served separate from khoresh so it never got the taste of khoresh and was too hard to chew! if you wanted it with two khoresh (as you can easily order in other persian restaurants) you had to order second khoresh separately.
I ordered my tahdig with Fesenjoon but it was just Fesenjoon sauce, no meat!!
author: Neda M.

description: Amazing food. This is now my favorite Persian restaurant in the city. Will be bringing all my friends and family here. First time I finished literally everything on my plate. Loved it.
author: Tina M.

description: Nice little restaurant with very reasonable prices. I liked the Halim and am looking forward to trying the kabobs.
author: Mohammad S.

description: My husband took me here for dinner and the service and food was absolutely wonderful. We ordered a lot so we could have left overs for the next day, and we barely had any food left to take home! There are only a handful of Persian restaurants in San Francisco, and this one is definitely at the top of the list for us. You must try the fesenjoon and tahcin! The bread that they serve with their cheese and herb plate is also amazing. Oh, and the service is on point. Such a friendly, cozy, and sweet little place that feels like home. Can't wait to go back!
author: Beeta O.

description:
First of all, I'm Persian, and I thought the food was fantastic. 

I've been to all the Persian restaurants in SF. Everything tasted very homemade. 

I came here on a Saturday night and had no trouble getting a table (for now). The place is run by a very kind family, so it feels like you're sitting in a friend's kitchen waiting for your dinner. 

Really loved the vibe and the friendly service. Go in for the food and comfort, not for five-star restaurant service. If you need something just ask and don't be offended that they didn't read your mind. 

P.S. I'm over Maykadeh. They're too foofy and quality is very inconsistent. Lavash is awesome, but it can be a trek to get there. I'll be visiting Anar often :)
author: Karl P.

description:
First time here and the first thing i see is the owner giving out food to a homeless man. What a sweet, wonderful man. The whole staff here is genuine and polite.
Amazing food and love the variety. Its a must!
author: Yasaman M.

description: Really nice folks and unassuming atmosphere. I had the lamb chops and they were grilled perfectly. The rice was also very flavorful and expertly prepared.
author: Ray N.

description:
Food and service was great! Came in with my husband and 3 kids and their service was awesome. Yes, the wait for food might be a little longer but it's worth the wait. Food is made to order and not just kept
On warm in a back burner. They greeted my children with books and puzzles; anyone who goes out of their way to please gets 5 stars in my book.
author: M.Y. A.

description:
Wow. Just fantastic. Fresh, unique, and all around delicious (I got the lamb kebob and the smoked eggplant, along with a lamb meatball stew special)! 

This place is ON POINT!!
author: Matthew G.

description: Great food and great service! I loved the Tah Dig and their Shole zards!
author: Fardin A.

description: Really filling kebabs. Meat quality is excellent. Saffron rice. Also try the eggplant appetizer. They just opened so easy to get a table. Expect liquor license next week. The owner comes out and thanks you for coming.
author: ilya v.

description:
I work across the street from this place and finally ate there last night. I was pretty impressed!

First off, the service is a bit raw which is to be expected from a brand new, family-run establishment. But it's not bad service - all of the staff were very friendly.

More importantly, the food was excellent. We ordered a big kabob plate (lamb and beef) and I could not decide which meat I liked more. Every bite changed my mind. The rice that came with it was surprisingly good, as was the roasted tomato. We also had a big yellow bell pepper stuffed with rice and beef. I suppose it could have used more beef, but it was delicious nonetheless. The tangy red sauce it sat on was great if not a bit difficult to get into the pepper (ended up pouring the plate on to the pepper). These two plates were more than enough food for the two of us.

I look forward to going back soon.
author: Phil D.

description:
Ok, really 4 stars because the waitresses were struggling.
Great date place. Good wine list, and the food is great, exactly as advertised.
I hate giving us such a good review, because I don't want it to get crowded.
I would love to see it stay open later in the evenings.
author: Eric T.

description: The food is excellent and the ambiance is very Soma, sexy, and minimalist. I really think this is an excellent addition to SF and an amazing high quality Persian food. I now go here all the time!
author: Rolf S.

description: Have been coming to this restaurant for a while now and I could not be happier with the food. Get the Sholeh-Zard for the dessert and you will be thrilled by the real Persia rice. Super delicious!
author: Sam K.

description: I have been here once! the food is ok but they must work on their serving! when taking order, u must be a bit more professional!ask if ur customer needs any drinks any side dishes?! after when ordering tea for example ask they want a small or big size!! sorry but u really need to work on this area! good young people running this place the food is ok.
author: Mari V.

description:
The sophistication and elegance of Persian food, and the sweet warmth of a family-run restaurant...I love this place!
Last night we had two appetizers and two entrees...none of whose names I can recall... but they were uniformly complex, bright dishes. And I've never dreamt that RICE could be so phenomenal!
One note...they are waiting a week or so for their wine/beer license, so until that comes through, bring your own.
author: Chris S.

description: Nice family owned restaurant. Friendly staff and excellent food.  Of all the Persian places in sf I like this the most.   Their food has a nice home cooked meal feel to it because it is.
author: DocDarien D.

description: Anar has to be hands down the best persian restaurant in San Francisco. The joojeh and kobideh are amazing and the staff makes some amazing persian tea. The tahdig is also incredible. This place is a must try!
author: Armando C.

description:
Delicious Persian food,I had the Lamb - chops which where done to perfection 
and very flavorful.We where a party of four and each of us choose a different
main course and everyone loved each bite of there's.
Wait staff where charming and very professional and the decor of the Restaurant 
has a quiet and modern ambiance.
I love Persian food and there are several of them in San Francisco,who over 
the years have just lost there luster.
author: Renee B.

description: I've recently gotten into persian food and been going from kebab place to kebab place (unfortunately, there aren't too many) hunting for the best Koobideh. I can finally stop searching, because I've found it at Anar. Not only does it taste amazing, the portions are generous also. The wait staff is friendly and attentive. Can't wait to go back!
author: Julio C.

description:
i would have reviewed this restaurant higher but it's a matter of principle.

The restaurant is nice for a date.

The food was pretty good, but not quite as good as Lavash.  

Here is the problem:
i ordered takeout.

I ordered straight off the menu, just how they word it.  i am eating for one, mind you.  i ordered an entree with 2 extra skewers.  Instead, i received 3 entrees, which is too much food, and way more costly.  i let them know that i even clarified at the time of order that i only wanted one entree with the extra skewers.  they said "this is the only way we do it".  

i am not a cheapskate, but i'm calling b.s.  take out customers are important, because although you may have a local celebrity every once in a while that you can post on facebook, i will visit 3x a month or more because i eat out every day.  i  will not order from here again.
author: eshwar k.

description: This place is a great alternative to the local Persian options like Lavash (my personal favorite although it can be a bit pricey/overly fancy), Maykadeh and Alborz. This is more home cooking style with menu items you don't see at a typical persian restaurant like Mirza Ghasemi and Lubia Polo. Great food, reasonably priced and friendly service. My wife is Persian and we often crave Persian food and it's good to have some choices.
author: Elia L.

description: Stumbled upon this place that just opened. Fantastic food and good service! The best fesenjun I have ever had.
author: Grayzine L.

description: The best Persian cuisine in San Francisco! Loved the environment! The food was great! And the service was also perfect!
author: Mahshid S.

description: Food was hot and well prepared with authentic Persian flavors. Staff was friendly and helpful. I had a table with a variety of people from around the world and some of the staff spoke a bit of Turkish, Farsi and various other languages. One person's food came late and the bathroom needed a bit of attending, however, the food was very, very tasty so, despite a few minor bumps here and there 4 stars it is.
author: Dawn Y.

description:
I have been going to Anar , since they have opened it , all I can say , this place gets just better and better , love everything about it , food , service , atmosphere and quality is incredible .Try Ash Anar , it is a new item in the menu .
Thank you Anar Crew .
author: Mellany A.

description:
The only issue with Anar is that the family that run it does not have much (or any) experience in this business. Sometime I feel like they don't have any idea how to handle some situations. Personally I have never had a bad experience there.  The hostesses are nice and they try their best. I have been there a couple of time and I feel like each time I had a better experience than the time before. Maybe their service is not the best, but there is something about the restaurant that makes me want to go there more often.

When it comes to the food itself though, you can compare them with any other Persian/Iranian restaurant in the Bay Area. Their Koobideh is simply the best. Their Barg, Shishlik, and Baghali polo are really good as well. I am sure the chef has years of experience cooking these cause the food in this restaurant tastes the way it should!
author: Masoud V.

description:
Awesome food!
Excellent service !!
Really friendly environment. 
I had soltani and my wife had jojeh kabab, they were just perfect!!
We enjoyed 
Ask for homemade "doogh" 
Highly recommended 
San Francisco need more Persian Restaurant like this.
author: Ali H.

description: I really liked this place. Consistent food and service.  Always easy to get a table  &  Friendly staff.First and foremost an excellent restaurant serves excellent food. This place not only meets this expectation but surpasses it with comfortable seating, relaxing ambience and gentle music to make you feel somewhere far away in the persian food. Thanks guys!
author: Timothy R.

description: We ordered kashk-e-bademjoon as appetizer, koobideh as the main dish and tea with baklava as dessert. All were delicious. The saffron on rice was mixed with rose water that gave more aroma to it however my wife likes saffron by itself. I highly recommend this place if you want to eat a good quality Persian food.
author: Amin F.

description: It was awesome. The staff were very friendly and the atmosphere was artistic and soothing. You wont regret to spend your money here.
author: Sepideh R.

description: Very fresh and tasty food, traditional flavors with an Americanized twist.
author: Curtis M.

description: Great food and very friendly service. Their barg kabob is the best, tender and juicy.
author: Yas M.

description: Family owned persian restaurant that gives u not only the great food but also provides the warm hospitality that pairs really well with high quality food. Good job and keep it up. We'll be back soon.
author: Rana K.

description: I love Anar -- makes me think of my grandma's delicious cooking! We've been going to Anar for about 6 months and every time we go or get take out we're always impressed. The food is delicious (I always get the joojeh kabob, and the mast-o bademjoon is AMAZING!).
author: Grace N.

description: The food was solid but not outstanding, nice service and drinks but overall, it's not worth walking all the way down a not so great block.
author: Fabien-Pierre N.

description: Nice restaurant. Lot's of delicious items. I most recommend the Fesenjoon (chicken-pomegranate stew).
author: Webb P.

description: I have eaten here a couple of times now, they serve very very good Iranian food. The family that runs the restaurant is imminently hospitable, and you can feel their warmth and sincerity. The guy on kebabs knows his way around with that huge metal skewer. Thank you for the great food, I will be back.
author: Roy L.

description: A great lunch spot in SOMA. Really interesting cuisine - a great way to break up the monotony of the typical lunch spots. I would totally go back here again and again.
author: Christina C.

description: What a pleasant surprise. The food was fabulous. We celebrated our son's birthday and it was delicious. My father is a vegetarian and he was so pleased with the menu and food. The family that owns the restaurant is so welcoming and sweet. Well worth it.
author: Stephen B.

description: Loved this place! The chicken kabob I had was cooked perfectly, and the service was great. Will be back.
author: Nick L.

description: We just had lunch here. First of all the service is superb. The food is very good and you like everything they make. It is very easy to find parking. The best of all they do not have 15 % service chareg for  more than six in the group, so take your party there.
author: MOREY D.

description:
I had an excellent experience in this restaurant. the food was great also the service was very good
I will definitely go back there soon
author: Zoha A.

description: Amazing kebab, rice, and tahdig. I've tried all the other Persian places in SF, and this is by far THE BEST. Definitely make sure to eat here and bring your friends because they will love it, too.
author: Joe D.

description:
It breaks my heart to review this place as such because it has great food.  But the service is terrible. 

The owner who is a nicer older man who is bald he's always sitting outside in his car smoking a cigarette as do the waitresses there.  Now handwashing is an important aspect of any food handling. I have seen the owner walk in from smoking a  cigarette in his car and walk straight into the kitchen and handle bread and put bread inside those bread baskets with his hands without washing them.   Also the waitresses there smoke and I have seen them smoke outside as well and I have not once seen them come back and going to the restroom and wash their hands or go back in the kitchen and wash their hands.  I think even before any of the staff or the owner or people who handle food walk into the kitchen once they come inside the restaurant from smoking a cigarette they should go directly inside the restrooms and wash their hands so people eating there can have a state of mind that their food is being handled by clean hands.  

 The two sisters that work there who are related to the owner clearly need to take a lesson in waitressing and proper etiquette's.  They forget orders. U have to repeat things twice to them or sometimes they just forget. I can understand and respect a family business but even as a waitress one needs to be confident in their job.  They handle food poorly.
author: Marcus M.

description: I ate here today and I had the best food.  I ordered shish kabob and it was delicious.  Excellent service and very friendly people!  Highly recommend this place if you want the best Persian food in the Bay!
author: Mike L.

description: Wow, just loved this place. Family operated and amazing and authentic Persian Cuisine. My girlfriend and I had a great experience there, and we saw a large group there as well and they were loving the food, service, and experience. Check this cool little authentic and delicious place in SOMA.
author: Martin G.

description: Eat24 took 2.5 hours to deliver my order. The food was great but the delivery came at room temperature.
author: Joseph A.

description: Best Persian dishes in very reasonable portions for the price! Highly recommended
author: Hesam S.

description: We found out about this place by chance, which turned out to be a very positive dining experience.  Anar in Farsi means pomegranate. There are multiple calligraphy on one wall with the word Anar written in different  styles.  On another wall are more paintings.The hostess was very friendly and we got a table right away.  Our server promptly took our orders.  We ordered Kashk Bademjoon and Mast khiar for appetizers.  Both were very delicious and very appetizing especially the Kashk Bademjoon which had the right consistency of eggplant, herbs, and whey( Kashk).  I've tried Kashk Bademjoon in other Persian restaurants, but this was by far the best. For our main course, we ordered, khobideh kebab ( ground beef)  Soltani Kabab ( ground beef and barbeque beef) Chicken barg kebab and khobideh.  We loved the food, the kebabs were very tender and juicy without so much fat and the basmati rice with saffron was very tasty.  For desert, we had Persian ice cream which tastes like gelato & was very yummy.  Overall, we rank this restaurant as the top Persian restaurant in SF & will be coming back.
author: Nasrin N.

description: The atmosphere is nice and cozy. The waitresses are super sweet. The food is very delicious. And to top it all, I loved the fact that they has a water hose for toilet use! I went there with five people, each ordered a different dish, and each one was amazing! Definitely recommend getting Bastani and chai after the main dish!
author: Reem B.

description: I loved the service here! The chicken kebab was by far the best I have had in any Persian restaurant in the Bay Area. Definitely recommend it and coming back!
author: Reese Y.

description:
By far the WORST service I have EVER experienced.
To clarify, I dealt with these people at a wedding where they were hired to cater the food. I have never been to their restaurant. I also work in the service industry as a beverage caterer and I was working the wedding along side of them in the same kitchen. From the start they were extremely rude and unwilling to help my staff or the wedding planner. Throughout the night I would walk back to our bussing station (which was separate from Anar's work area) and I would find their trash in our trash cans, which they were trying to sneak into the cans so they didn't have to take it with them at the end of the night. They would also take our glasses, without asking, and use them for their staff to drink coffee. Then they would just leave the dirty glasses on the table and not even return them to their proper place. Anar's staff would not help the wedding planner with anything that was not "in the contract." The plates and silverware were rented from a third party and for that reason, Anar's staff refused to help bus dirty dishes off the tables. I was only supposed to be dealing with the glassware from our bar, but because of their lack of participation, I had to bus the dirty plates off the tables as well. Not only did I have to do more work because of the unhelpful staff at Anar, but also the wedding planner and a few of the guests at the wedding ended up bussing dirty plates! I have never EVER been to a wedding where the guests had to bus plates because the caterers were refusing to do so.
The fact that the caterers were letting guests bus because they were refusing to do so would have been bad enough on its own. Unfortunately that is not all they were doing wrong. 
One last inconsiderate behavior Anar's staff exhibited that I will mention is that at the end of the night, they had a bunch of food left over and they wanted to leave it behind. This normally wouldn't be an issue but there was so much food that there was nothing to do with it all. The wedding planner gave some of it away to the guests but that wasn't enough. The wedding planner then asked the caterers to take the rest with them because she couldn't do anything with it. At this point, the caterers got in a huge yelling battle with each other and then started yelling at the wedding planner! Something as simple as taking your own trash with you was such a big deal for these people. They ended up leaving the food behind for the wedding planner to deal with. At this point I was in absolute disbelief at how these people do business. I ended up taking Anar's trash home in our company truck and disposing it at our warehouse. 

If you are ever thinking of hiring these people to cater an event for you, DO NOT DO IT! It will cost you way more than it is worth. There are far better caterers out there. There is better food available, and nicer people who will work with you. The only reason I am even giving them a single star is because there isn't an option for zero stars.
author: Collin R.

description: great service, delicious yogurt appetizer...and the koobideh kabab was excellent!  easy parking...easy to find.  would go back anytime!
author: Ara L.

description: had the soltani here. koobideh was amazing and the lamb filet perfectly cooked. rice was fluffy and very well seasoned (I often think Persian restaurants go a little overboard with seasoning their rice, not the case here). will definitely be coming back for as long as they keep this high quality up.
author: William Y.

description: 4pm on Sunday we entered the restaurant. They were very busy. We waited at least 30 minutes and no one approached to great or tell us the wait time. Finally I approached one of the girls to see how long would it take to have a table. Overwhelmed she said I have no idea, don't wait :(. Disappointed and hungry we headed to our beloved Maykadeh.
author: Nasrin A.

description: i had lunch with  couple of my friends on Sunday ,i ordered the mix kobide and chicken kabab and really like it.I've seen some complaint about service by other members here but my from  experience it  was so good and satisfying.i wish they have more options in their drinks but for sure i will be there again.
author: Mohammad M.

description: My favorite Persian spot in SF! Great prices (unlike some others around town) and the juiciest koobideh and best tasting saffron rice I've ever had.
author: Nick S.

description: Best koobideh (kabob) in all SF. Nicest staff. I don't know how some people give this place any bad reviews. They are consistentantly great. Their bagheli polo is fantastic too. Get their saffron ice cream every time if you have any room :)
author: Pegah E.

description: I love Persian food and was very excited to try Anar. I have gone twice at lunch during the week. The food is very tasty and I have been happy with both meals. However the customer service is seriously lacking. Servers are a bit gruff and seem uncomfortable performing their duties. One of the women actually raised her voice to my lunch companion when he didn't hear her question regarding rice or bread. It took over 30 minutes to be served our lunch. Then when we asked for a box and the check, we had to ask for both 2 more times and waited another half hour. Restaurant owners' should understand how week day lunch business works. Nobody can waste  that much time and we have to get back to work. Sadly, Anar is very close to being taken off the list for lunch places. I will try 1 more time but the service must improve. I can see no way for the success of Anar without  first rate service.
author: Kam O.

description: I wouldn't eat this place. I could find a better one that can serve better persian foods.
author: Sam S.

description: Food is amazing. We had Loobia Polo, Barg, koobide, and jooje kabab. They were all great but my favorite was loobia polo since no one else can get it right. This is closest that you can get to home cooking. Service was good too. Friendly people.
author: azin s.

description: We had the Soltani, Tadeek ... Great food w great service. Check them out ...
author: Payam K.

description: Absolutely love the food -- tastes authentic and flavorful. The family that owns it is very sweet and accommodating. My husband and I will be back! Keep up the exquisite flavor!
author: Tara K.

description: I tried this lovely restaurant a week after it opened.  I plan on returning the next time I come into the city.   I ordered tea, chicken kabob and the feta cheese appetizer.  The two beautiful girls were very charming and checked on me often.  Everything was delicious.  The art work is gorgeous!!!
author: Suzanne G.

description: Excellent Persian food in SOMA.  A great place to sample this cuisine, very friendly staff and simple tasteful environment.  Highly recommended and no I don't know the management :-)
author: Stephen R.

description: Our mainly discovery / trial lunch at Anar today turned out an excellent dining experience.  We ordered chicken and ground-meat skewer (kabobs), walnut-pomegranate sauce (fesenjoon) and veggie plate, as well as Persian salsa salad, stuffed vine-leaf (dolmeh) and egg-plant in yogourt and also the yogout drink (doogh).  They all were very delicious, not fatty, and well presented.  The place is clean, well organized and well lighted with high ceilings.   Later, we learned that the entire staff are members of the same family.  That explained the reason for the excellent service that we received today.   We are hoping that they can keep their positive attitude, and their quality for years to come, no matter how business environment would turn out to be.
author: Bijan D.

description: Good atmosphere. The food quality is hit or miss. Chicken was very good, but koobideh very bad. Baghali polo was good. Service, not special. Price, too high for the package
author: Mohsen H.

description: Exceptional Persian home cooking: delicious and fresh with lovely service.
author: Diane D.

description: It's the best persian restaurant that I've tried. Beautiful, cozy, and well design with the awesome, tasty, and fresh food. Service was great and servers was very kind and friendly. I would definitely go there very soon again and suggest you to try.
author: Alireza N.

description: delicious food. great service, good value. try the chicken kebab and the wonderful feta with fresh herbs and the pomegranate juice. been here lots and don't tire of it
author: Ian V.

description: My friend and I ate here last night(Saturday night around 9pm) and I highly recommend it. We ordered boneless chicken kebobs with Basmati rice, it came with a grilled tomato and green bell peppers on the side for $14. The chicken breast was done to perfection and very juicy and not dry at all.  We also ordered Ghormet Sabzi(sauteed herbs, lamb chunks, kidney beans, rehydrate lemons, etc) with Basmati rice for about $18. All very delicious. We each ordered a glass of Cabernet and Zinfandel, not bad, not great either. Our hostess and waiter were extremely polite and gracious. The place had one other table occupied when we arrived and maybe that was due to rain or arriving so late because they usually stop serving around 9:30pm. Suggestions: I think the lighting could be a bit dimmer because we had to change our corner table due to the halogen light spotlight kinda blinding my partner. Maybe more candles at night? And yeah, don't sit at the window unless you'd like to observe the homeless passing by and putting on a show and a show they do. Hmmm, dinner and a show, win win! Overall, kidding aside, a great place, great atmosphere, great service, and great food.
author: Marc N.
